11111112.content:
You smile as you pack up your stuff as you marvel at your current situation; you can do anything you want. You then start to think of a way you could use this to your advantage. You could make the world a better place, you could end world hunger, or even you could meet aliens. Or better yet, you could take this to a whole new level. You instantly run into a broom closet, making sure no one would see what you were doing. You smirk as you snap your fingers creating a floating full body mirror to show your reflection.

"Now, let's see what would make this school flip?" You thought aloud, before an actual light bulb appears overhead. "I've always wanted to do that. Now to focus on my plan. First, a change is in order." You snap your fingers, causing your body to be engulfed in a plume of smoke. The smoke cleared, revealing a fine woman in the reflection instead of your normal appearance. She had long blonde hair, that went past her shoulders, wearing these lovely smokey blue earrings. She had tan skin, wearing a blue bikini top with a floral print on the nips, along with a matching bikini bottom. "Oh man, I look hot. I wonder how much attention I'd get."

You walk out of the closet, slamming the door wide open as everyone turns to you with shocked expressions. You smirk flipping your hair back as you began to take a walk down the hall, all eyes on you. A nearby guy was walking staring at you, only to trip over a trash can causing you to snicker a bit. Another guy was skating in the hall, he soon caught sight of you causing him to not look ahead and crash into the corner. You laugh as you kept seeing guy after guy trip over themselves, as well as earning a few glares from girls. 'I guess not all of my lookers can be happy.' You thought as you saw a few nearby nerds in larping gear.

"Hey boys, wanna take a look at these twenty sided dies." You offered causing the nerds to faint against the lockers. 'This is just way too easy. Not only that, no one knows its me. I could do this all day.' You thought as you started to turn a corner, only to accidentally bump into Rachel. "Oh, hey Rachel." You smile innocently, as she stares at you weirdly before she realized who you were.

"You didn't." She deadpanned.

"I did." You smile widely.

"Come with me." She grabs you, as you and her were instantly teleported to the empty gymnasium. "I can't believe you used your power to parade around the school like a random bimbo."

"Hey! For your information, the guys of this school liked this body." You defended yourself, causing Rachel to roll her eyes at you.

"Of course they do, they're guys!" Rachel remarked, as she pouts at you.

Plus it feels painless." She looks to you for a second, but then thought about it for a while. She was soon engulfed in a plume of blue smoke, before it cleared revealing a different girl in her place. She had sky blue hair, along with blue snowflake like earrings with matching blue lipstick, her eyes a night sky blue. She was wearing a snowflake like dress with white fuzz all over the end of it, wearing dark blue gloves with the same white fuzz at the end along with two beads hanging on each end. She was wearing blue platform boots, along with white knee high socks. You smirk snapping your fingers, causing a mirror to appear in front of her.

"Woah, I look good." Rachel poses in the mirror like a runway model.

choices: You wake up, someone found you
1411.content:
Staggering backwards a few steps from the force it took to open the box, you are now able to look inside at its contents. A thick gold chain necklace was secured inside, a pale blue glow surrounded its edge and filled the space between the links. You stare at the chain which looked way too big for the box it was in, feeling a strange power emanating from it. Another quick look confirmed that you were still alone, "I'd better get this to the lost and found or something...", you decide and were just about to close the case again when without thinking, you stroke the side of the chain with one of your finger knuckles. It was ice cold to the touch, but on the instant that you did, the blue glow disappeared from the chain. Pulling your hand back, you jump at the realization of this subtle difference. You pluck up the courage to reach out another finger to touch its surface. Reaching out, you let out a small shout as you see that the glow that was on the chain was now on your knuckle in the place where you touched it. Astounded, you watch the circular glowing region as it moves up your finger, spreading out across the back of your hand and then up your arm, illuminating your white shirt from within as it went. Once it reached your shoulder, you could no longer see it but it it didn't go down so you could only assume it was going up your neck. Dashing towards the first reflective surface you can find, which happens to be a window in the door of the food hall, you can make out your worried face, the glowing dot moving its way steadily upwards. You watch it reach the centre of your forehead where it paused. You look back down to the box in your hand, the chain had disappeared "Oh yeah, that'd be about right wouldn't it?", you think to yourself, returning your attention to the glowing dot on your forehead. It had started pulsating, sending waves of light across your body. The frequency of the waves increaced until you couldn't tell if it was still pulsating or if your whole body was now just glowing constantly.

You bring your hands to your face, examining them in the window, noticing that the box had followed the chain and disappeared, but this was the least of your worries, "I'm frickin' blue!", you exclaim down the empty hallway. Looking down the corridor into the school, half hoping nobody would see you and half hoping somebody would come and help, you become aware that your shadow cast against the wall had gone. Turning back to the window, you pull your hands back up to your face, puzzled and even more frightened now that the glow had left your body and everything seemed normal. A glint caught your eye and you examine yourself in the reflective window. Pulling your collar down out of the way, you see that the gold chain had somehow found itself around your neck. It didn't feel cold like it did before, in fact it didn't even feel like it was there. You move your hand as if to touch it, when the burning cold like before ignited again on your finger and you saw only black
1411.title: An object

14111.content:
"Hello? Hello? Can you hear me?", you were vaguely aware of someone calling you from far away but your vision was still black.

*SLAP!!*

Eyes opening, letting glorious technicolour flood in, you sit bolt upright rubbing the side of your face, "What the fuh...", you stop yourself mid sentence when you realize the person who had slapped you was the school nurse.

A crowd had gathered around you while you'd been on the floor, you think you see Rachel among the people but she quickly turned and left in a flurry of blond hair. "Come with me young man, I think it'd be best if you went home for the day", the nurse offered her hand to pull you up. Grabbing hold, you stand up and follow her down the corridor. Turning back you see the headteacher had made an appearence and the crowd of students had quickly disapparated, again you think you see Rachel looking down the corridor but the glance was too quick to be sure.

14111.title: You wake up, someone found you

141112.content:
"Now what was that all about hey? Not been feeding you enough have I? Go lie down on the sofa and I'll bring you a nice warm drink!"

"Thanks mum", you say and trudge into the living room, launching yourself onto the sofa. You still had a headache, probably from collapsing earlier but you had no idea what had brought it on. 'Wait! That chain thing!' , reaching up to your neck, you can feel the chain still there but it seemed thicker and bigger than when you'd last felt it. You try to take it off so your mom won't see but it clings stubbernly to your neck moving over your skin but never away from it.

In a whirlwind, your mom re-entered the room brandishing a mug of hot honey and lemon. "Here, this ought to help whatever it is that you've got", she said, giving you the mug and settling on the sofa by your feet. After a moment of careful watching to make sure that you'd taken a sip she continued "Now, I've got to go back into school, not your school obviously, my one. You're lucky I could come and get you, any later and I wouldn't have been able to leave my class. Make sure you're OK and ring me if anything happens, love you!", and with that she pecked you on the forehead and bustled out of the room. Your mom taught some of the lower years at a local school, you'd been there several times when you were younger and ill so you were glad she decided not to take you this time.

Still puzzled about earlier, you put down your drink and start thinking about the chain again. Even though you'd blacked out earlier, you feel fine now, like nothing had happened but still you couldn't pull this chain off your neck. While you were thinking, your dog Baxter came padding in from the kitchen, he was allowed free roam around the house when everyone was out which your dad didn't like in the slightest. "Hey Bax", you say while stroking him, "I'm really confused about today, could you help me?", the dog just sat there waiting to be petted again, "I'll take that as a yes. OK. Let's think, I was in the cafeteria, I found this box with some jewellry inside it, I touched this chain and it disappeared into me, then the box disappeared, then the chain reappeared, I fainted and now I can't get this damn thing off me!" The dog panted and wagged its tail "Ahh it's no use, the more I think about it the stranger it gets.", Baxter then seemed to nod his head before running back off into the kitchen.

You stand up and head up the stairs to your room. Passing the mirror in the hallway you stop to examine the chain, the collar on your white shirt covered most of it up but you could still see it glinting where you'd taken your tie off. It was a thick chainlinked gold chain that went right the way around your neck (like this: http://www.tnsdiamonds.com/MonsterGold/D... ) but you couldn't feel any weight coming from it. You undo the top few buttons of your shirt to get a better view of it. Events were still racing through your mind 'I fainted then someone slapped me, I woke up, Rachel...' you pause, transfixed on the gold glare the chain was giving and repeat in your head 'Rachel...'
141112.title: In the car/at home

142.content:
Walking over to the table the shoe box like wooden box stares at you. While the box has no etching the wood grain has natural swirls without any knots. Curiosity overwhelms you causing you to pick up the box. The coins rattle as they slide fall to one side. Looking closer you notice a small slit at the top and realize it is a bank of sorts. You glance at the box turning it over the coins inside protesting you looking for a way to release them.
The bell rings loudly ushering you back into reality. Part of you thinks you should leave the box on the table while another part thinks you should take it with you.
